title: Are there tax consequencies in deed in lieu of foreclosure? I was discharge in chapter 7.
question: After chapter 7 is discharged. Is there any tax consequences if I go with deed in lieu of foreclosure? Is the property still mine until it is sold on deed of sale date? I was told by my bank that the house is on foreclosure but is ownership still mine until deed of sale date?
answers: Debts discharged in BK are not taxable events. If a 1099 is issued on a debt discharged in BK, simply file IRS Form 982 with your return and check the appropriate box.

I agree with attorney Stempler. Code Section 108 of the Internal Revenue Code specifically excludes taxation of debt discharged in a bankruptcy from cancellation of debt income. You should have your tax return prepared by a professional this year to correctly claim your exclusion and fill out all the appropriate forms.

If you have discharged your debt obligations in your Chapter 7 Bankruptcy and not reaffirmed that you would continue to stay in the house, then there should be no tax consequence for any debt discharged by the Bankruptcy. Debts discharged under the Tile 11 (the Bankruptcy Code) are excludable from gross income. See page 5 of IRS Publication 4681, linked below.
